title: @truffle/hdwallet-provider ChainID limitation.  "Chain with ID  not supported" when connect to private geth networks
body:
- [x ] I've asked for help in the [Truffle Gitter](http://gitter.im/Consensys/truffle) before filing this issue.

---------------------------

## Issue


Hello I get **truffle migrate** command error:  "Chain with ID  not supported" when use module **@truffle/hdwallet-provider** connect to a **remote private geth network** that has a chainID . 
Following an example where network chainID was 1871
## Steps to Reproduce

- create a private geth network (my version is based on geth v1.10.3)
- configure truffle.js 

`const HDWalletProvider = require("@truffle/hdwallet-provider");

const gasPrice = 1000000000; //process.env.GASPRICE;
let privateKeys = ["ad94c2949c05b2368418d4dac4281e60808b865fffbfe0a5ed0d0c9d8230717d"];
const network = "http://myprivatenetwork:1234";
const chainId = 1871 ;

  networks: {

    development: { 

      provider: function () {
        return new HDWalletProvider(
            {
                privateKeys: privateKeys,
                providerOrUrl: network,
                chainId: chainId
            }
        )
    },
      network_id: "*",
      gas: 6000000,
      gasPrice: gasPrice
    }
  }`
## Expected Behavior
able to connect to the network and deploy the smart contract.

Interesting, what happens if you omit the chain id in the configuration? Would you be willing to provide specific steps for all this (along with a sample project) so I can try and reproduce your error?
@eggplantzzz thanks for comment. without chain Id can't connect to the network since the chainID method been implemented.
updated to the @truffle/hdwallet-provider (v1.4.0) , old version was 1.3.0 and problem solved
